intro: Tithymalus densus, commonly known as the dense tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a mild scent when crushed. Tithymalus densus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
